alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 4:04PM EST until March 09 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Flatrock River near Columbus. East Fork White River at Columbus. .Ongoing and renewed flooding will continue or develop along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers over the next 24 to 48 hours and beyond. River stages are rising again due to the one to over two and a half inches of rain received from Saturday night through this morning. Minor flooding is expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flatrock River near Columbus. * WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, On April 6, 2011 after reaching 13 feet... Noblitt Park...CR 400N and Owens Bend Park remained flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 12.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued later this evening.
